verses.text: \w When|strong="H1961"\w* \w the|strong="H1129"\w* \w wall|strong="H2346"\w* \w had|strong="H1961"\w* \w been|strong="H1961"\w* \w rebuilt|strong="H1129"\w* \w and|strong="H5975"\w* \w I|strong="H7891"\w* \w had|strong="H1961"\w* \w set|strong="H5975"\w* \w the|strong="H1129"\w* \w doors|strong="H1817"\w* \w in|strong="H5975"\w* \w place|strong="H1961"\w*, \w the|strong="H1129"\w* \w gatekeepers|strong="H7778"\w*, \w singers|strong="H7891"\w*, \w and|strong="H5975"\w* \w Levites|strong="H3881"\w* \w were|strong="H1961"\w* \w appointed|strong="H5975"\w*.

\w Then|strong="H3588"\w* \w I|strong="H3588"\w* \w put|strong="H6680"\w* \w my|strong="H5921"\w* brother \w Hanani|strong="H2607"\w* \w in|strong="H5921"\w* \w charge|strong="H5921"\w* \w of|strong="H8269"\w* \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, \w along|strong="H5921"\w* \w with|strong="H5921"\w* \w Hananiah|strong="H2608"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w commander|strong="H8269"\w* \w of|strong="H8269"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w fortress|strong="H1002"\w*, \w because|strong="H3588"\w* \w he|strong="H1931"\w* \w was|strong="H1931"\w* \w a|strong="H3068"\w* faithful man \w who|strong="H1931"\w* \w feared|strong="H3372"\w* God \w more|strong="H7227"\w* \w than|strong="H5921"\w* most.

\w And|strong="H1004"\w* \w I|strong="H5704"\w* told \w them|strong="H1992"\w*, “Do \w not|strong="H3808"\w* \w open|strong="H6605"\w* \w the|strong="H5704"\w* \w gates|strong="H8179"\w* \w of|strong="H1004"\w* \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* \w until|strong="H5704"\w* \w the|strong="H5704"\w* \w sun|strong="H8121"\w* \w is|strong="H1004"\w* \w hot|strong="H2527"\w*. \w While|strong="H5704"\w* \w the|strong="H5704"\w* \w guards|strong="H4931"\w* \w are|strong="H1992"\w* \w on|strong="H3427"\w* \w duty|strong="H4931"\w*, \w keep|strong="H4931"\w* \w the|strong="H5704"\w* \w doors|strong="H1817"\w* \w shut|strong="H1479"\w* \w and|strong="H1004"\w* securely fastened. \w And|strong="H1004"\w* \w appoint|strong="H5975"\w* \w the|strong="H5704"\w* \w residents|strong="H3427"\w* \w of|strong="H1004"\w* \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* \w as|strong="H5704"\w* \w guards|strong="H4931"\w*, \w some|strong="H1992"\w* \w at|strong="H3427"\w* \w their|strong="H1992"\w* \w posts|strong="H4931"\w* \w and|strong="H1004"\w* \w some|strong="H1992"\w* \w at|strong="H3427"\w* \w their|strong="H1992"\w* own \w homes|strong="H1004"\w*.” The List of Returning Exiles (Ezra 2:1–67)

\w Now|strong="H1419"\w* \w the|strong="H8432"\w* \w city|strong="H5892"\w* \w was|strong="H5892"\w* \w large|strong="H1419"\w* \w and|strong="H1419"\w* \w spacious|strong="H7342"\w*, \w but|strong="H5971"\w* \w there|strong="H8432"\w* \w were|strong="H5971"\w* \w few|strong="H4592"\w* \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w in|strong="H1004"\w* \w it|strong="H8432"\w*, \w and|strong="H1419"\w* \w the|strong="H8432"\w* \w houses|strong="H1004"\w* \w had|strong="H3027"\w* \w not|strong="H5971"\w* yet \w been|strong="H4592"\w* \w rebuilt|strong="H1129"\w*.

\w Then|strong="H5414"\w* \w my|strong="H5414"\w* \w God|strong="H5414"\w* \w put|strong="H5414"\w* \w it|strong="H5414"\w* \w into|strong="H5927"\w* \w my|strong="H5414"\w* \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* \w to|strong="H5927"\w* \w assemble|strong="H6908"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w nobles|strong="H2715"\w*, \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w officials|strong="H5461"\w*, \w and|strong="H5971"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w to|strong="H5927"\w* \w be|strong="H3820"\w* \w enrolled|strong="H3187"\w* \w by|strong="H3187"\w* \w genealogy|strong="H3187"\w*. \w I|strong="H5414"\w* \w found|strong="H4672"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w genealogical|strong="H3187"\w* \w register|strong="H5612"\w* \w of|strong="H5971"\w* those \w who|strong="H5971"\w* \w had|strong="H5414"\w* \w first|strong="H7223"\w* \w returned|strong="H5927"\w*, \w and|strong="H5971"\w* \w I|strong="H5414"\w* \w found|strong="H4672"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* following \w written|strong="H3789"\w* \w in|strong="H3789"\w* \w it|strong="H5414"\w*:

\w These|strong="H4428"\w* \w are|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H7725"\w* \w people|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H7725"\w* \w province|strong="H4082"\w* \w who|strong="H1121"\w* \w came|strong="H5927"\w* \w up|strong="H5927"\w* \w from|strong="H7725"\w* \w the|strong="H7725"\w* \w captivity|strong="H7628"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H7725"\w* \w exiles|strong="H1473"\w* \w carried|strong="H1540"\w* \w away|strong="H7725"\w* \w to|strong="H7725"\w* Babylon \w by|strong="H5892"\w* \w Nebuchadnezzar|strong="H5019"\w* \w its|strong="H7725"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w*. \w They|strong="H1540"\w* \w returned|strong="H7725"\w* \w to|strong="H7725"\w* \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* \w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, \w each|strong="H4082"\w* \w to|strong="H7725"\w* \w his|strong="H7725"\w* own \w town|strong="H5892"\w*,

\w accompanied|strong="H5973"\w* \w by|strong="H3478"\w* \w Zerubbabel|strong="H2216"\w*, \w Jeshua|strong="H3442"\w*, \w Nehemiah|strong="H5166"\w*, \w Azariah|strong="H5838"\w*, \w Raamiah|strong="H7485"\w*, \w Nahamani|strong="H5167"\w*, \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w*, \w Bilshan|strong="H1114"\w*, \w Mispereth|strong="H4559"\w*, Bigvai, \w Nehum|strong="H5149"\w*, \w and|strong="H3478"\w* \w Baanah|strong="H1196"\w*.\f + \fr 7:7 \ft Parallel text at Ezra 2:2 accompanied by Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Seraiah, Reelaiah, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispar, Bigvai, Rehum, and Baanah\f* \w This|strong="H3478"\w* \w is|strong="H3478"\w* \w the|strong="H5973"\w* \w count|strong="H4557"\w* \w of|strong="H4557"\w* \w the|strong="H5973"\w* \w men|strong="H5971"\w* \w of|strong="H4557"\w* \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*:
the descendants of Parosh, 2,172;
the descendants of Shephatiah, 372;
the descendants of Arah, 652;
the descendants of Pahath-moab (through the line of Jeshua and Joab), 2,818;
the descendants of Elam, 1,254;
the descendants of Zattu, 845;
the descendants of Zaccai, 760;
the descendants of Binnui,\f + \fr 7:15 \ft Binnui is a variant of Bani; see Ezra 2:10.\f* 648;
the descendants of Bebai, 628;
the descendants of Azgad, 2,322;
the descendants of Adonikam, 667;
the descendants of Bigvai, 2,067;
the descendants of Adin, 655;
the descendants of Ater (through Hezekiah), 98;
the descendants of Hashum, 328;
the descendants of Bezai, 324;
the descendants of Hariph,\f + \fr 7:24 \ft Hariph is a variant of Jorah; see Ezra 2:18.\f* 112;
the descendants of Gibeon,\f + \fr 7:25 \ft Gibeon is a variant of Gibbar; see Ezra 2:20.\f* 95;
the men of Bethlehem and Netophah, 188;
the men of Anathoth, 128;
the men of Beth-azmaveth,\f + \fr 7:28 \ft Beth-azmaveth is a variant of Azmaveth; see Ezra 2:24.\f* 42;
the men of Kiriath-jearim, Chephirah, and Beeroth, 743;
the men of Ramah and Geba, 621;
the men of Michmash, 122;
the men of Bethel and Ai, 123;
the men of the other Nebo,\f + \fr 7:33 \ft Or of West Nebo\f* 52;
the descendants of the other Elam,\f + \fr 7:34 \ft Or of West Elam\f* 1,254;
the descendants of Harim, 320;
the men \f + \fr 7:36 \ft Literally the sons; here and in verse 37\f* of Jericho, 345;
the men of Lod, Hadid, and Ono, 721;
and the descendants of Senaah, 3,930.
\w The|strong="H3548"\w* \w priests|strong="H3548"\w*: the descendants of Jedaiah (through the house of Jeshua), 973;
the descendants of Immer, 1,052;
the descendants of Pashhur, 1,247;
and the descendants of Harim, 1,017.

\w The|strong="H1121"\w* \w Levites|strong="H3881"\w*: the descendants of Jeshua (through Kadmiel, through the line of Hodevah \f + \fr 7:43 \ft Hodevah is a variant of Hodaviah; see Ezra 2:40.\f*), 74.
\w The|strong="H1121"\w* \w singers|strong="H7891"\w*: the descendants of Asaph, 148.

\w The|strong="H7967"\w* \w gatekeepers|strong="H7778"\w*: the descendants of Shallum, the descendants of Ater, the descendants of Talmon, the descendants of Akkub, the descendants of Hatita, and the descendants of Shobai, 138 in all.

\w The|strong="H1121"\w* \w temple|strong="H5411"\w* \w servants|strong="H5411"\w*:\f + \fr 7:46 \ft Hebrew The Nethinim; also in verses 60 and 73\f* the descendants of Ziha, the descendants of Hasupha, the descendants of Tabbaoth,
the descendants of Keros, the descendants of Sia,\f + \fr 7:47 \ft Sia is a variant of Siaha; see Ezra 2:44.\f* the descendants of Padon,
the descendants of Lebanah, the descendants of Hagabah, the descendants of Shalmai,
the descendants of Hanan, the descendants of Giddel, the descendants of Gahar,
the descendants of Reaiah, the descendants of Rezin, the descendants of Nekoda,
the descendants of Gazzam, the descendants of Uzza, the descendants of Paseah,
the descendants of Besai, the descendants of Meunim, the descendants of Nephushesim,\f + \fr 7:52 \ft Nephushesim is a variant of Nephusim; see Ezra 2:50.\f*
the descendants of Bakbuk, the descendants of Hakupha, the descendants of Harhur,
the descendants of Bazlith,\f + \fr 7:54 \ft Bazlith is a variant of Bazluth; see Ezra 2:52.\f* the descendants of Mehida, the descendants of Harsha,
the descendants of Barkos, the descendants of Sisera, the descendants of Temah,
the descendants of Neziah, and the descendants of Hatipha.

\w The|strong="H5650"\w* \w descendants|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H5650"\w* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w*: the descendants of Sotai, the descendants of Sophereth, the descendants of Perida,\f + \fr 7:57 \ft Perida is a variant of Peruda; see Ezra 2:55.\f*
the descendants of Jaala, the descendants of Darkon, the descendants of Giddel,
the descendants of Shephatiah, the descendants of Hattil, the descendants of Pochereth-hazzebaim, and the descendants of Amon.\f + \fr 7:59 \ft Amon is a variant of Ami; see Ezra 2:57.\f*
The temple servants and descendants of the servants of Solomon numbered 392 in all.

\w The|strong="H5927"\w* following \w came|strong="H5927"\w* \w up|strong="H5927"\w* \w from|strong="H5927"\w* \w Tel-melah|strong="H8528"\w*, \w Tel-harsha|strong="H8521"\w*, \w Cherub|strong="H3743"\w*, Addon,\f + \fr 7:61 \ft Addon is a variant of Addan; see Ezra 2:59.\f* \w and|strong="H3478"\w* Immer, \w but|strong="H3808"\w* \w could|strong="H3201"\w* \w not|strong="H3808"\w* prove \w that|strong="H3478"\w* \w their|strong="H1992"\w* \w families|strong="H1004"\w* \w were|strong="H3478"\w* \w descended|strong="H2233"\w* \w from|strong="H5927"\w* \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*:
the descendants of Delaiah, the descendants of Tobiah, and the descendants of Nekoda, 642 in all.

And from among the priests: the descendants of Hobaiah, the descendants of Hakkoz, and the descendants of Barzillai (who had married a daughter of Barzillai the Gileadite and was called by their name).
These men searched for their family records, but they could not find them and so were excluded from the priesthood as unclean.
The governor ordered them not to eat the most holy things until there was a priest to consult the Urim and Thummim.\f + \fr 7:65 \ft Literally Lights and Perfections\f*
\w The|strong="H3605"\w* \w whole|strong="H3605"\w* \w assembly|strong="H6951"\w* \w numbered|strong="H3967"\w* 42,360,

\w in|strong="H5650"\w* addition \w to|strong="H5650"\w* their 7,337 \w menservants|strong="H5650"\w* \w and|strong="H3967"\w* maidservants, \w as|strong="H5650"\w* well \w as|strong="H5650"\w* their 245 \w male|strong="H5650"\w* \w and|strong="H3967"\w* female \w singers|strong="H7891"\w*.
They \w had|strong="H1581"\w* 736 horses, 245 mules, \f + \fr 7:68 \ft Some Hebrew manuscripts (see also Ezra 2:66); most Hebrew manuscripts do not include this verse.\f*
435 camels, \w and|strong="H3967"\w* 6,720 donkeys. Offerings by the Exiles (Exodus 38:21–31; Ezra 2:68–70)

Some \w of|strong="H7218"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w heads|strong="H7218"\w* \w of|strong="H7218"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* families \w contributed|strong="H5414"\w* \w to|strong="H5414"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w project|strong="H4399"\w*. \w The|strong="H5414"\w* governor \w gave|strong="H5414"\w* \w to|strong="H5414"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* treasury 1,000 darics \w of|strong="H7218"\w* \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*,\f + \fr 7:70 \ft Or 1,000 gold drachmas; that is, approximately 18.5 pounds or 8.4 kilograms of gold coins\f* 50 bowls, \w and|strong="H3967"\w* 530 priestly garments.

\w And|strong="H3701"\w* \w some|strong="H5971"\w* \w of|strong="H7611"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* heads \w of|strong="H7611"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* families \w gave|strong="H5414"\w* \w to|strong="H5414"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* treasury \w for|strong="H3701"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* project 20,000 darics \w of|strong="H7611"\w* \w gold|strong="H2091"\w* \f + \fr 7:71 \ft Or 20,000 gold drachmas; that is, approximately 370.4 pounds or 168 kilograms of gold coins; also in verse 72 \f* \w and|strong="H3701"\w* 2,200 \w minas|strong="H4488"\w* \w of|strong="H7611"\w* \w silver|strong="H3701"\w*.\f + \fr 7:71 \ft Or 2,200 silver minas; that is, approximately 1.38 tons or 1.25 metric tons of silver\f*

\w The|strong="H3605"\w* rest \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w people|strong="H5971"\w* gave \w a|strong="H3068"\w* \w total|strong="H3605"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* 20,000 darics \w of|strong="H1121"\w* gold, 2,000 minas \w of|strong="H1121"\w* silver,\f + \fr 7:72 \ft Or 2,000 silver minas; that is, approximately 1.26 tons or 1.14 metric tons of silver\f* \w and|strong="H1121"\w* 67 \w priestly|strong="H3548"\w* garments.

So the priests, Levites, gatekeepers, singers, and temple servants, along with some of the people and the rest of the Israelites, settled in their own towns. And by the seventh month the Israelites had settled in their towns.
